title: Use the double angle formula: $$cos\left(2\theta\right)=2{cos}^{2\left(\theta\right)}-1$$. Set this equal to $$\frac{3}{5}$$ and solve for cos(theta).
After finding cos(theta), find sin(theta) by substituting the value for cos(theta) into $${sin}^{2\left(\theta\right)}+{cos}^{2\left(\theta\right)}=1$$.
Finally, use the defintions of tan, cosecant, secant, and cotangent to find each respective value.
